variant.question: You are on an IFR flight in IMC. You have been cleared to descend from FL370 to FL60 at the initial approach fix (IAF) for an ILS approach to runway 08 at the destination. ATC requested that you report passing FL180\. You receive no acknowledgement from ATC when passing FL180 and suspect a communication failure. What action should you pilot take?

options.text: Proceed to fly the current flight plan and land within 20 minutes after the estimated time of arrival.
Continue the descent to FL60, squawk 7600 and land as soon as possible.
Maintain FL180 and proceed to fly the current flight plan route to the appropriate designated navigation aid to fix serving the destination aerodrome, before commencing descent.
Proceed to the IAF, descending to FL60, and hold over the IAF to arrive at, or as close as possible to, the estimated time of arrival resulting from the current flight plan.

variant.question: You are on an IFR flight in airspace where radar is NOT used in the provision of air traffic control. You are experiencing a complete radio failure and were unable to report your position at the last compulsory reporting point. You shall maintain the last assigned speed and level, or minimum flight altitude if higher, for a period of how long after failing to report your position over the compulsory reporting point?

options.text: 25 minutes.
30 minutes.
15 minutes.
20 minutes.

variant.question: ATC observes that an aircraft in their sector has recently altered its assigned squawk code, transitioning from 2000 to 7600\. What does this change indicate?

options.text: The Pilot will declare a Mayday.
Communication failure.
Unlawful interference.
The Pilot has changed to the standard discrete code.

variant.question: A pilot has set the transponder code to 7600\. This indicates..

options.text: distress.
radio failure.
loss of position.
unlawful interference.

variant.question: You are flying IFR and approach your destination airport in VMC. After experiencing a communication failure:

options.text: Continue the approach, land and report your arrival.
Make a low approach and wait for visual signals of the ground personnel.
Squawk 7700 and continue in accordance with the flight plan.
Continue to the destination aerodrome, adding 500 ft to all the altitudes in the flight plan.

variant.question: An air traffic controller observes an aircraft\`s SSR code to be 7600\. This indicates..

options.text: aircraft interception.
a hijacking.
loss of communication.
an emergency.

variant.question: An aircraft is squawking 7600\. What does it indicate?

options.text: It is diverting to the alternate aerodrome.
It is about to make a forced landing.
It is unable to establish communication due to radio equipment failure.
It is requesting immediate level change.

variant.question:
Should a pilot lose communication during a flight, which are the correct ways of trying to re-establish air-ground communication?

1\. Use the company ground frequency   
2\. Contact other aircraft   
3\. Use the previous frequency   
4\. Use the pilot-to-pilot frequency   
5\. Use another frequency appropriate to the route.   
6\. Contact other aeronautical stations   
7\. Use the designated standby frequency
Approaching the Top of Climb (TOC) on an IFR flight, a pilot suffers a total loss of communications. The aircraft is currently in VMC conditions. What will be the next course of action?

options.text: Continue to fly the flight planned route, hold at the initial approach fix until the estimated approach time, then proceed to commence an instrument approach at the destination aerodrome.
Continue to fly in VMC, proceed to land at the nearest suitable aerodrome and report the arrival to the appropriate Air Traffic Services unit as soon as possible.
Continue to fly in VMC, proceed to land at the destination aerodrome and report the arrival to the appropriate Air Traffic Services unit as soon as possible.
Continue to fly in VMC or IMC, proceed to land at an aerodrome that provides radar services.

variant.question: A pilot is under radar control, flying in IMC, and has just reached the cleared altitude. 8 NM before the mandatory reporting point he/she suddenly suffers a radio failure, and sets the appropriate SSR code. Given the sequence of events, how long must the pilot maintain the last cleared altitude or minimum flight altitude (whichever is higher)?

options.text: 12 minutes from reaching the last cleared altitude.
7 minutes from setting the SSR code.
7 minutes from failing to report at a the compulsory report point.
12 minutes from setting the SSR code.

variant.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in VMC should..

options.text: land at the alternate aerodrome.
return to the aerodrome of departure.
land at the destination aerodrome.
land at the nearest suitable aerodrome.

variant.question: Under which of the following circumstances shall an aircraft station squawk 7600?

options.text: When approaching a prohibited area.
When entering bad weather areas.
When flying over desert areas.
In case of radio communication failure.

variant.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in IMC should..

options.text: execute a VMC approach at the nearest suitable aerodrome.
divert to the most suitable aerodrome according to the route of flight.
proceed to an area from where the flight can be continued according to the visual flight rules.
proceed in accordance with the current flight plan to the designated navigation aid serving the destination aerodrome.

variant.question: While being radar-vectored in IMC, the pilot loses radio contact with ATC. Taking into consideration the minimum flight altitude, his/her initial action is to rejoin the current flight plan..

options.text: at the final approach fix.
at the designated navigational aid.
no later than the next significant point.
at the initial approach fix.

variant.question: ICAO has reserved a set of SSR codes for pilots to use in certain conditions. Which of the following is correct?

options.text: 7700 – Unlawful Interference.
7500 – Communication Failure.
7600 – Communication Failure.
7600 – Distress.

variant.question: At what point should you initiate your descent during an approach in the event of communication failure?

options.text: As close as possible to the last received Expected Approach Time (EAT).
As soon as you enter the final approach segment.
Immediately after the last received clearance.
Upon reaching the minimum descent altitude (MDA).

variant.question: An aircraft flying on the traffic circuit of a controlled aerodrome is encountering radio communications failure. What is the correct course of action?

options.text: Set the transponder code to 7700 and perform radio checks, at 1-minute intervals, to all aeronautical stations.
Rock the aircraft wings and flash navigational lights, at irregular intervals, to signal communication failure.
Transmit blind, on the APP secondary frequency, the number of souls on board and remaining fuel.
Transmit blind your messages, twice, and watch for instructions which may be issued by visual signals.

variant.question: An aircraft experiences an air-ground communication failure while on an IFR flight. If equipped with an SSR transponder, what Mode A code is it expected to squawk?
During the cruise, you begin to experience a lot of noise on the radio frequency and it becomes unusable. Which of the following is the appropriate action?

options.text: Switch to 121.500 MHz immediately.
Stay on the frequency in use and wait for it to improve.
Find an alternative frequency.
Go back to the previous frequency.

variant.question: An aircraft experiencing radio communication failure on an IFR flight in VMC should..

options.text: continue to fly in VMC, land at the nearest suitable aerodrome, and report its arrival.
leave controlled airspace and continue the flight within uncontrolled airspace.
continue the flight to destination aerodrome.
squawk IDENT and proceed to the alternate aerodrome.

variant.question: What phrase shall be used in the event of a disruption of communication for which it has been identified that the receiver is the cause of the malfunction?

options.text: Communicating blind due to radio failure.
Transmitting blind due to receiver failure.
Blind emission.
Blind transmission.
